comments:
Opened for IBM, using an editor based on the WTP web services models and item providers, during edit an exception is thrown and the editor is left out of synch

Exception thrown when trying to NotifyChanged to a Widget that is already Disposed.

The stack trace is :
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed
 at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2942)
 at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2865)
 at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2836)
 at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:408)
 at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java:344)
 at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Table.setSelection(Table.java:2484)
 at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer.setSelectionToWidget(TableViewer.java:1031)
 at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.setSelectionToWidget(StructuredViewer.java:1494)
 at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.preservingSelection(StructuredViewer.java:1208)
 at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh(StructuredViewer.java:1262)
 at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh(StructuredViewer.java:1221)
 at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.webservice.adapter.AdapterViewer.notifyChanged(AdapterViewer.java:59)
 at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.BasicNotifierImpl.eNotify(BasicNotifierImpl.java:229)
 at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotificationChainImpl.dispatch(NotificationChainImpl.java:113)
 at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotificationChainImpl.dispatch(NotificationChainImpl.java:101)
 at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotifyingListImpl.setUnique(NotifyingListImpl.java:918)
 at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.set(BasicEList.java:558)
 at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.webservice.command.CommandSetElement.execute(CommandSetElement.java:76)
 at org.eclipse.emf.common.command.BasicCommandStack.execute(BasicCommandStack.java:91)

I can see this problem. I think it is seriouse enough because it actualy does not report any error. It does not inform the user that their attempt to edit was not successful.
Any attempt after that to update would be just ignored by the editor scilentley till the user restart the workspace.

This is not a WTP issue.  This issue should be resolved at the IBM level.  The fact that the AdapterViewer is in the stacktrace is just a side effect of the real problem.  It is trying to refresh the table and this table is disposed.  Who is disposing the table? That is the real problem.  This is most likely an editor framework issue or the actual web service editor being used.
